reviews.review_msg: Eugene is one of my favourite professors I have had at SFU. He explains things so well during lecture and I found all of his assignments actually enjoyable to do. He really does care about his students and Is passionate about what he teaches. I would take all my classes with Eugene if I could.

Amazing guy, super nice, the class average was above what the people at the top wanted but he didnt make exams harder, he told them that his students just love the class:). Class was about 30 people so he said if it was larger he wouldnt do that, but still. Class average was B+

Very cool Scottish guy. You really do work for your grade in his class, but attending lectures really helps. His enthusiasm is inspiring and it helped grow my interest in the subject material, especially since he uses examples from the Metro Vancouver area.

If you have the opportunity to take one of his classes, do it!

Eugene is a cool dude who is compassionate about the topics he teaches. He's very caring, and provides clear criteria and feedback for assignments. Reading the textbook is very important for assessments in this course. Participation in lectures isn't mandatory, but tutorials are graded by participation. Would recommend!

Great teacher, great sense of humour, and great Scottish accent! Class is never boring as he likes to draw on real-life current events as examples of course themes. I actually didn't like cities much that long ago, but now I am in Urban Studies and have a new found direction I never would have seen if not for the enthusiasm of wonderful Eugene!
Caring prof that is always accessible for extra help and goes out of his way to be helpful.

Eugene is one of the best professors I have had at SFU thus far. His teaching methods are thorough and easy to follow. His interests and research areas shine through in his presentations and geographic analysis' of Vancouver. This being said, he is a fairly hard marker. I didn't find it too difficult because he made me want to push myself to learn.

The work you put in this course is what you get out! There is a lot of work, but if you attend lectures, take good notes, and do all the assigned readings you will get a satisfying mark! Eugene is very passionate in what he teaches, which makes learning from him a wonderful experience! You'll leave the class as a "critical urban geographer."
He's good

Go to the lecture and take good notes. The study guide for the midterm and final exam are extremely useful and are almost identical to what to expect. Just try to memorize all the class notesstudy from the study guide and you'll do good in this class.
Hands down the best Geog prof at SFU. ...well him or Geoff Mann. Awesome course, doing the readings is a must but what you will get out of it is beyond worth it.

It was a complete privilege to listen and learn from him. He is brilliant and well- rounded. Very engaging, clear and considers his students. He is humble yet profound in his thinking. Excellent speaker and very intelligent. He always made me "think" and question everything. Maybe I questioned too much but it is this reason why I want to learn more

Eugene is the best professor/teacher I have ever had. Very clear and makes the subject extremely interesting. To get a good grade you do have to work hard, but you'll take great satisfaction from achieving in this class. And the material you learn will stick with you for a long time and make you highly knowledgeable on the subject of Global Cities
I found the marking for the class to be quite fair/not too hard. He's able to communicate the material very well and is very helpful through email. Definitely a good professor to have for geography.

McCann is challenging, but excellent. I hate him, but love him. He kicked my butt at first, but with his guidance on writing and counseling, I did very well. This course is not easy, and neither is McCann, but he is the best profession I have had thus far. Be on your game, and do the readings.

This guy is slightly off his rocker. He made us write one brutal paper, it was almost like writing a journal article. Also marks very hard...so be on your game and do your readings! This course should be 5 credits rather than 4...

This course is intense, demanding, and will definitely provide a reality check if you're not on your game. The upside is that your work habits will improve.  Prof's teaching style is authoritarian but he's also fair. Don't be late and don't eat in class. If you respect his rules and do the readings you'll be fine.

WOW EXTREMELY HARD marker. The expectations are insanely high in this class but I think all economic geography courses are like this. You have write an empirical research paper. Its almost like trying to write like a paper for your MBA. He is a good lecturer though; He explains concepts well. ALOT of readings and be prepared to work your butt off!

Excellent professor with superb teaching style and excellent clarification of confusing topics (rare). He is very attractive, which made it somewhat difficult to concentrate. He is very interested in the subject matter which makes for very interesting classes and discussions. He usually makes comments about himself and his family, and then blushes!

I had no interest in taking this class but it turned out to be one of my favorites.  There are lots of readings every week and the paper can be a choice of topics covered in class dealing with Vancouver.  If you need a 'W' course, take this class.  Eugene is a good lecturer and encourages questions.
Marking is Hard but Prof is great..no text book but lots of readings....only take course if interested in planning but overall i like course and he is a great prof.

BY FAR THE BEST GEOGRAPHY PROF AT SFU! For anyone who hasn't yet taken a class with eugene you are surely missing out. A very fair and organized prof who is passionate and interested in the material. Above all else, a friendly and easy going guy. Just awesome.

Great prof, always there to help if you have a question.  Fair marker, makes lectures interesting and uses real life examples to prove his points and theories.  Other Profs should take a note from him on how to properly teach!
Love his teaching style, he is very easy to talk to if you are having a problem.  I have taken 3 classes with his and I wish that he taught more!!!  Great Accent
He's really nice and has a good sense of humour, he's really easy going. He makes the course material interesting.

great prof. seems to start out the class a little slow and is a little unorganized. pay extreme attention to lectures. no need to read the Hall textbook. funny relaxed type of guy that brings some very relavent and interesting ideas to the table

The handout he gives you b/f the midterm and final helps immensley. As for the papers the TA was responsible for those. With 20 minutes to go in the last tutorial she complains they were all poorly done. She then promptly hands them out and leaves the room.. With 20 minutes left! The second paper is killer because it is near impossible to relate to
Clear lectures, doesnt move too quickly, very fair on the midterm and final questions.  Seemed to have easier material in 362 then 261 though...

Interesting class! It's hard to understand him at times with his accent though. You only need to know the main points and the term paper was very interesting. Highly recommanded if you are doing a Geography major/minor.

Very good prof. Articulates ideas very well, and is funny on top of it. His tests aren't bad if you know your stuff. Memorize lecture notes and your guarenteed a good mark. Keep up with readings but really only have to know the main points.

Excellent prof. Strongly related lectures and readings, divides class into themes. Very well organized. Most of the marking were done by TA's. For midterms and finals, just understand the major points in readings. Strongly recommended!

Not a very good prof. Not knowledgeable about Canada. Expects us to mindlessly regurgitate course material on essays without having our own opinions. 2 essays each worth 10% and lots of funny rules about how to write that don't make sense. Essays only 5 pages but min. 7 sources but don't stray fromt the message given in lecture--impossible! Avoid!
Excellent.  Figure out his exam expectations and keep up with your readings
Very interesting lectures. The study guides that he gives really help with studying. But a lot of us were in for a shock for the mid term. His marking ranges from fair to hard.
This prof seems like a good guy and his lectures are alright but his marking is unfair.  Always refers to America in examples and has a messed up marking scheme.  I wouldnt recommend him.

He has issues with powerpoint and ends up wasting a lot of time in class fiddling with it. He also uses examples almost solely from America. His marking scheme is very inconsistent, but he's helpful if you go and talk to him.
No Comments

Really great prof and really great guy! Loved his teaching style, lectures really interesting!!  However, I was really surprised that he used the United States version of grading. Anyone who got under 60% failed, and 60%-70% was a D ect. All in all, great
Great prof! Great class! Great guy!

Loved the class. Actually wanted to go to the lectures because they were so interesting! Awesome teaching methods, never a dull moment! A very approachable and fair teacher! Two thumbs up!!  I would love to take another class with him!
awesome prof
Very nice teacher. Very fair. Interesting lectures! Scottish accent makes the lectures more fun!! Very helpful and well prepared.  Highly reccommended!
